critical_issues.issue: ALL 9 FILES: Table existence checks via sqlite_master (PROHIBITED)
critical_issues.description: Every file checks if tables exist using SELECT name FROM sqlite_master. This violates schema contract architecture - schema.py guarantees table existence.
critical_issues.fix: Remove all table existence checks and conditional returns. Rules MUST assume all contracted tables exist.

critical_issues.issue: ALL 9 FILES: Hardcoded SQL queries without build_query()
critical_issues.description: 23 SQL queries across 9 files use raw cursor.execute() without schema validation. This breaks schema contract compliance.
critical_issues.fix: Convert ALL queries to use build_query() from schema.py for automatic column validation.

critical_issues.issue: bundle_size.py: Severity uses STRING instead of Severity enum
critical_issues.description: Variable 'severity' contains string values ('MEDIUM', 'LOW') from PACKAGE_METADATA dict (line 43-52), passed directly to StandardFinding without enum conversion.
critical_issues.fix: Convert severity strings to Severity enum: severity=Severity[severity] or use Severity.MEDIUM directly

critical_issues.issue: peer_conflicts.py: Phase 3C fix confirmed (cursor reuse bug)
critical_issues.description: Lines 63-64 show fix applied: packages_with_peers = cursor.fetchall() stores results before second query. Comment at line 63 confirms this was a Phase 3C fix.
critical_issues.fix: No action needed - bug already fixed. Verify similar pattern not present elsewhere.

critical_issues.issue: update_lag.py: Intentional hybrid design (database + file I/O)
critical_issues.description: File reads .pf/raw/deps_latest.json (line 60) in addition to database queries. Architecture note at lines 6-19 explicitly documents this as intentional hybrid approach for network optimization.
critical_issues.fix: No action needed - this is documented architectural decision, not a violation.

critical_issues.description: config.py contains 13 frozensets for O(1) pattern matching: PYTHON_TYPOSQUATS, JAVASCRIPT_TYPOSQUATS, SUSPICIOUS_VERSIONS, RANGE_PREFIXES, PACKAGE_FILES, LOCK_FILES, DEV_ONLY_PACKAGES, FRONTEND_FRAMEWORKS, BACKEND_FRAMEWORKS. All correctly implemented.
critical_issues.fix: No action needed - gold standard pattern followed.

peer_conflicts.py.bug: Cursor reuse bug - second query overwrote first query results
peer_conflicts.py.fix_applied: Line 63-64: packages_with_peers = cursor.fetchall() stores results before second query
peer_conflicts.py.comment_evidence: Line 63: '# ✅ FIX: Store first query results before executing second query'

summary.most_common_violation: Table existence checks via sqlite_master (9 occurrences across all files)
summary.second_most_common: Hardcoded SQL without build_query() (23 occurrences across all files)
summary.phase_3c_regression_check: PASS - No new regressions, confirmed 1 fix from Phase 3C still in place

recommended_actions.action: Remove ALL table existence checks (sqlite_master queries) from all 9 files
Convert all 23 hardcoded SQL queries to use build_query() from schema.py
Add schema.py imports to all files: from theauditor.indexer.schema import build_query
Document hybrid architecture in update_lag.py is intentional (already done at line 6-19)

audit_conclusion: The dependency category requires IMMEDIATE refactoring. All 9 files violate schema contract architecture with 100% consistency. While frozensets are correctly used in config.py and Severity enums are mostly correct in findings, the fundamental database access patterns are non-compliant. Phase 3C fix in peer_conflicts.py confirmed working. Estimated total refactor time: 3-4 hours to bring entire category to gold standard compliance.
